channel.title: Bio on Matthieu Jimenez Website
channel.description: Recent content in Bio on Matthieu Jimenez Website

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hello everyone,

On this page you will find all relevant information about me. For more detailed information, I invite you to visit my Linkedin

Since October 2014, I’m a PhD student in the Serval team of the SnT Interdisciplinary Centre at the University of Luxembourg. I am also a teaching assistant at the FSTC(Faculty of Science, Technology and Communication ) of the University of Luxembourg.

My research interests are Vulnerability Prediction Models and Natural Language Processing.

Education

  • (Since October 2014) PhD Student - Vulnerability Prediction Modeling - University of Luxembourg, Interdisciplinary Center of Security and Trust (Serval Team)
  • (2014) Engineer’s degree (equivalent to MSc) in Computer Science (major in Computer Security) obtained with highest honors (rank 1 in final year) - Polytech Nice Sophia Antipolis - University of Nice, France
  • (2012 - 2013) One year Exchange - Polytechnique Montréal, Montréal Québec, Canada
  • (2011) 2 years degree in Applied Science - Polytech Annecy-Chambéry - University of Savoy, France

Experiences and Projects

Teaching

(Since 2014) Teaching assistant - FSTC University of Luxembourg

  • Algorithms
  • Introduction to Computer Science
  • Software Testing

Projects

  • (September - March 2014) Member of the SMARTCAMPUS project Group - SMARTCAMPUS project aims to equip the SophiaTech campus (Sophia Antipolis, France) with sensors collecting data about campus’ usage. Our role in this project was to create an architecture able to collect those data and to configure sensors in the campus remotely. Our primary concern was to deal with notion of scalability, heterogeneity, remote configuration and data accessibility - Polytech Nice Sophia Antipolis - University of Nice, France

Industrial Experiences

  • (2014 - 6 months) Security Trainee SEPAMail™ security - StreamMind - Paris, France
  • (2013 - 4 months) Security Trainee IPv6 security - Orange - Valbonne, France

Skills

Computer Science

  • Languages: Java, Kotlin, C++
  • Web: HTML5, CSS, JavaScrip
  • Office: Latex, Word, Keynote, Pages

Languages

  • French: Native
  • English: Fluent
  • German: Medium
